factoid: Rostóv shouted 'Hur-a-a-a-ah!' as a roar of voices.
Rostóv thought that anyone could come his way.
Rostóv drove his spurs into Rook.
Rostóv let Rook go at a full gallop.
Rook outstripped the others.
The enemy was visible ahead.
A thing resembling a birch broom swept over the squadron.
Rostóv raised his saber.
Rostóv was ready to strike.
Nikítenko was galloping ahead.
Nikítenko shot away from Rostóv.
Rostóv felt as if he was carried forward with unnatural speed while staying on the same spot.
Bondarchúk, a hussar known to Rostóv, jolted against Rostóv.
Bondarchúk looked angrily at Rostóv.
Bondarchúk’s horse swerved.
Bondarchúk’s horse galloped past.
Rostóv asked himself why he was not moving, that he had fallen and was killed.
Rostóv answered his own question.
Rostóv was alone in the middle of a field.
Rostóv saw only motionless earth and stubble around him.
Rostóv did not see moving horses or hussars’ backs.
Warm blood was under Rostóv's arm.
Rostóv said that he was wounded and that his horse was killed.
Rook tried to rise on his forelegs.
Rook fell back, pinning Rostóv's leg.
Blood was flowing from Rook's head.
Rook struggled but could not rise.
Rostóv tried to rise but fell back.
Rostóv's sabretache was entangled in the saddle.
Rostóv did not know where his men were and where the French were.
There was no one near Rostóv.
Rostóv disentangled his leg and rose.
Rostóv asked himself where the line that had sharply divided the two armies was.
Rostóv could not answer that question.
Rostóv wondered whether something bad had happened to him.
Rostóv felt that something superfluous was hanging on his benumbed left arm.
Rostóv's wrist felt as if it were not his.
Rostóv examined his hand and found no blood.
Rostóv thought joyfully that people were coming.
Rostóv saw men running toward him.
A man in front wore a strange shako, a blue cloak, was swarthy, sunburned, and had a hooked nose.
Two more men came after the front man.
Many more men ran behind.
One of the men said something strange in a language not Russian.
A Russian hussar was among the hindmost men wearing similar shakos.
The Russian hussar was being held by the arms.
The Russian hussar's horse was being led behind him.
